action.action-desc: Ms. McSally (for herself, Mrs. Comstock, Mr. Cook, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Franks of Arizona, Mr. King of Iowa, Mr. Knight, and Mr. Rohrabacher) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To reauthorize the State Criminal Alien Assistance Program, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: Section 241(i)(5) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1231(i)(5)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the em dash and all that follows through (C); and

paragraph.header: Assistance for states incarcerating undocumented aliens charged with certain crimes
paragraph.text: Section 241(i)(3)(A) of such Act (8 U.S.C. 1231(i)(3)(A)) is amended by inserting charged with or before convicted.

paragraph.header: Assistance for states incarcerating unverified aliens
paragraph.text: Section 241(i) of such Act (8 U.S.C. 1231(i)), as amended by paragraph (1) and subsection (a), is further amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting and medical expenses after incarceration;
by redesignating paragraphs (4), (5), and (6), as paragraphs (5), (6), and (7), respectively;
in paragraph (7), as redesignated, by striking (5) and inserting (6); and
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

paragraph.text: In the case of an alien whose immigration status is unable to be verified by the Secretary of Homeland Security, and who would otherwise be an undocumented criminal alien if the alien is unlawfully present in the United States, the Attorney General shall compensate the State or political subdivision of the State for the incarceration and medical expenses of the alien in accordance with paragraph (2).
